page.title: 07Housing-Witton & Ridlington
page.content: An area of scattered housing with no centre to the villages & no settlement pattern.Most houses are owner occupied,a few are rented privately & some are holiday cottages.There are few second homes in comparison with other coastal areas. {Council Housing}to rent from the local council(N.Norfolk District Council) includes 12 houses & 8 bungalows for old people situated in Ridlington St. {Older housing}No very large houses or stately homes.Older houses are built of local soft red bricks & flints which may be knapped(dressed).Cottages nearer coast are often faced with small beach flints;roofs are sometimes thatched or of red pantiles.Some older houses are tied agricultural cottages. {Modern Housing}consists of a variety of bricks with tiled roofs.
